page.title: 12FARMING,SPETCHLEY AREA
page.content: As elsewhere in the UK, farming is bound very much by{Government and {EEC regulations. Most of the farms in the area are {tenant}holdings.Local soils affect the farming year,eg.Autumn sowing of corn is usual on the wet{Lias clays}of the East of our grid. Orchards are established as in the Vale of Evesham. {Crops}grown include wheat, barley, oats, peas and roots;dairy farming, however still has prominence.Old pastures have been ploughed up recently to make way for{increased {wheat growing. In this area,{herds}have been long established of Guernseys, Friesans Friesan/crossed Herefords and Shorthorns.Some{sheep}occupy the higher ground.Pigs and poultry are kept on one or two farms.There are very{few smallholdings}in the area.
